E16C70FFA57C4AACB6359D3BA8CB52E4.description: Demonstrate an understanding that responsible information users draw reasonable conclusions based on analysis and interpretation of information, follow policies when using shared resources, take the initiative to suggest improvements, and recognize that choices impact how the information will be used and by whom

F8577AEE55074642A1FD680A1637CB82.description: Demonstrate responsible citizenship in use of materials and resources

380D4A59C7D04802B86E36757A2BB763.description: Demonstrate an understanding that diverse ideas and world views which challenge a researcher are necessary for informed participation in the social interchange within information ecosystems

1A97E62754024023AA7F2227D7DC77B1.description: Advocate for intellectual freedom and uphold the rights of others

EE2A20C5DF134858800ABDD59D18136B.description: Set and use normative behavior agreements with ground rules and roles when working in groups, using more formal parliamentary procedure where required; demonstrate intellectual humility; contribute to the intellectual community rather than remaining only a consumer of information; value and evaluate others’ contributions; and seek guidance from experts

02B98EDD815B4B4ABEF7A99BE49FD532.description: Collaborate as members of a social and intellectual community

3B7F181AA32A4697A87F7431860467BC.description: Participate collaboratively, respectfully and productively as a member of a democratic society

7E70A1281E3146E5898E6E240E7D7606.description: With support, demonstrate an understanding of the concepts of intellectual property and originality, and use sources within the limitations of copyright law, the allowances of public domain, copyleft (open public copyright), or Creative Commons licenses, and read sources closely to understand the context for the given information to accurately represent the ideas in context

0344EE36CF3D4564B9D1C1CC7D037E73.description: Respect the intellectual property of others and copyright law when gathering, presenting, or publishing information

DEF42BE154034E20863D3218D3B34EDB.description: Use strategies to avoid plagiarism, use subject-specific citation styles, and demonstrate an understanding of the rights and permissions for use of intellectual property, including public domain, and Creative Commons licenses

8D669B6214A64CC0B4531C3B750BDAD5.description: Avoid plagiarism when gathering, presenting, or publishing information

90DBE7D08ED84832826E7136D90D3124.description: With support provide proper attribution and citations for sources, including identifying all necessary components for a complete citation within each source used, as required by the citation style for the field of study, constructing citations in proper format, using citation generators, and checking for accuracy

8AF4A38210D744A38DB9AC28FFBCB210.description: Seek accuracy, legitimacy, and reliability in sources, and be objective when searching and reading, and demonstrate an understanding of how particular sources, including crowdsourced, contribute to general knowledge

D011FFC1A04242D699607C3EF9F4E1DA.description: Use a variety of authoritative sources, considering multiple perspectives and points of view

9103D73DA7654AACB5B07E1991223B38.description: Practice ethical behavior when using print and digital resources

278680FB3C634033AA4503E2E976E6CD.description: Critically evaluate contributions made (including one’s own) in a variety of information environments, identifying biases, and evaluating the value of various perspectives

B634AE2695CE491EA5055AD626498ADB.description: Practice accuracy and consider bias when sharing information

204B5B9ED7314E478919BC51FA7DD589.description: As a contributor of information, decide how and where best to contribute; demonstrate an understanding of the safety and ethics involved with commodification of personal information and tracking of online interactions, and share content and interests appropriate to the forum

22CB410DE04041C893619A8C27971C54.description: Participate in and advocate for safe and ethical communication

974C9E2B091A451BB3CFC82F8D1DDE8A.description: Contribute to topical conversations at the appropriate level using accepted vocabulary and discourse; monitor reactions, and adjust participation as necessary

85BAD4555E614FF0A5695107E562ECB2.description: Use appropriate language when communicating with others

9634734EC038403F809B776B6CAAE3C6.description: Practice ethical behavior to share knowledge

32552BE6FB954FD099F1AC621FA16715.description: SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY: Share knowledge and participate ethically and productively as members of a democratic society

21F10D559CA4430DBF3EC56910ACE39F.description: Set a reading purpose applicable to the reading task and type of genre. Use metacognition to track changes and development in one's reading identity

96B480097D60407F9ED49327BC7B4635.description: Demonstrate resiliency, perseverance, and stamina when reading a variety of texts

8CB21C25D4A441FE8F3D5ACAD30E7C0F.description: Make connections from a wide variety of texts to personal, academic, or professional experience and knowledge

20C02C22F55848318E86A53D53712001.description: Make personal and global connections to the real world when reading a variety of texts

17E7F873BA234F0790C570555CFD8444.description: Recognize one’s identity as a reader, and extend reading experiences through a variety of genres and formats

4EF0BA0107F54806BC7953704886CBF5.description: Self-select reading materials from a variety of genres and formats

151AAEC9311A4A4490F88C6F79260C0B.description: Participate in reading and learning communities, to develop skills for increased academic conversations, and to further research and inquiry

E02511C049A442BBA7B955AF02458EB4.description: Contribute to a reading and learning community

C15F0AA557964DA9963AB0FFB1774F69.description: Apply reading strategies to text structures and standard formats found in scholarly research studies across content areas

E0A6901EFCC844369BE46C3ED93A0EC6.description: Apply reading strategies across the content areas

EC837DE866E1435CA1A63CBB7FC7E1A2.description: Build reading skills and behaviors for lifelong learning

8FBCC9171C0A4DCCBAA30AAF50D50C3C.description: Identify how an author or authors, including organizations and companies as authors, write with a variety of purposes and for particular audiences, and evaluate effectiveness of text to purpose

3B1C4DE3063848F9BDCAF2A47326AED0.description: Set a reading purpose for reading a particular text, and vary the reading strategies to fit the purpose

7B4830A6815949FBA737C7AE27B283C5.description: Read to understand history, current events, and to make personal decisions

17C7C87A442748BDBAE31CBCE3D42239.description: Critically analyze and evaluate the information presented in an information source, to locate evidence for building and supporting comprehension of texts, use comparisons to identify similarities or differences, ask inquiry questions when something from the text inspires seeking new knowledge

E4646202D2E447EDA9BB91D18784AC19.description: Demonstrate reading for meaning by evaluating evidence, drawing conclusions, and forming opinions

DE0C72A87A10442F83CC8A4C93459B7B.description: Monitor reading processes and identify problems, ask questions about the author’s ideas, use strategies to repair comprehension, summarize key points and reflect on important information in the text

F3E8D40ED1E745FABFEAFA0200B1F5EE.description: Demonstrate reading for meaning by finding the main and supporting details

288B7FDC7F7E431A9A8DFB48FC44E229.description: Surface background knowledge that will connect to new information, in order to revise schema, and develop a clearer understanding

E65EE226B68649B192EB87C05D6C1A52.description: Read, listen to, view, and integrate information to build background knowledge

4D3E988C495B4BFE94BC7EEAF88B5033.description: Comprehend, interpret and evaluate informational and fictional text

FB892FB73A464919B6161F3CB69E7EDA.description: Seek diverse and inclusive perspectives, be open to new ideas, recognize how selection of reading material affects the reader and can be empowering both personally and globally

DDB1B1090F9C44FDA76EA1BD6B59F18D.description: Read to seek multiple diverse and inclusive perspectives

83CA929ECDC4420DA462AC1C8FBA20A1.description: Identify the features of the author's craft including language choices, or scientific names and labels, that shape meaning, and identify the narrative voice and the authorial voice (including historical contextualization where relevant), which shape the relationship between author and reader

EE3AEAB949AD445A978B82A7C234276B.description: Appreciate and evaluate author's craft and use of literary devices

9AE655BC517F42C89EE28D81FAECA1D8.description: Reflect in discussions, and in writing, personal growth as a reader, and recognize how information sources may incorporate or promote social, historical, economic, political, and cultural commentary

E3F01745D9694636B30D49B5F6056142.description: Explore text to text, text to self, and text to world connections

2F682FC1C0AA48FF9B7B563EC60BB052.description: Recognize that information sources invite inference and interpretation within and across texts and experiences, to consider others’ evidence-based inferences and interpretations, and to synthesize relationships among personal ideas, ideas from texts, and ideas from discussions

A46418E6B0DC49FA8D51546884A0C266.description: Read to answer questions, make decisions, or solve problems

AC1FD085174948C69928A489E9DF39E3.description: Recognize universal themes and trace their development in information sources

DE9731432B304C10A96FECF1FCE67B3E.description: Identify, reflect upon and respond to works which exemplify the human experience

AD7E7F66B3D6462FB1BB1ECBF72C64D4.description: Select and read increasingly complex text from a variety of genres and formats, and develop a reading literacy agenda (increase range of selection, self-challenge to stretch abilities)

E8A1DAF4240A4883A04785908D271E39.description: Read, listen to, and view a variety of genres and formats

F68C8240814E44F18D8360D5FBAFCAF4.description: READING ENGAGEMENT Read to pursue lifelong intellectual, personal, and emotional growth

4DCA012554714A2A9148450571CE5C79.description: Identify and use specific criteria to track the acquisition of new understanding and to evaluate the effectiveness of a created product

2554FFFE7D3647A0861EC624D6EE7099.description: Reflect on a product's effectiveness in expressing and demonstrating new understandings

0262A1B84C2E454E80B206C7E40E6486.description: Set up a shared plan, use project management skills to equitably share new understandings, and create and share content in collaborative groups

0072E90923F24E4998BD761395DFDCD6.description: Collaborate with others to create original products and share new understanding

D4C1B91331DD403CB29E90BE73ECDEE6.description: Select the most appropriate tools to create and share work based on purpose and audience

4E36E7E508DE4C3DA3CF76DD79745F91.description: Use appropriate tools to create and share new work

644659500E064D40B999AB95E58341A8.description: Analyze delivery formats for clarity of communication, accessibility, audience, purpose, ease of use, and modes of learning to select the most appropriate format for sharing understanding

006B5495BEBF4C869B48268C8D8A57F2.description: Analyze delivery formats for sharing understanding

A02E5F144A2F4A6D944C168B7C23C08B.description: Use skills, resources, and tools to create and share work that expresses and demonstrates new understandings

E04A80A073C249FBA486001A1F798B26.description: Reflect on the development of new knowledge in a topic, and evaluate the effectiveness of the strategies and tools used in a research process

90BC8C34317842C2B4692F15D7402D54.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of the skills and tools used to create new knowledge

58841F4273AA45F68646A65BBC82A7B9.description: Make and defend informed conclusions based on complex criteria, including exploring multiple points of view, setting aside personal prejudices and assumptions, locating best evidence, and considering criteria specific to a topic

AD4B1A7AF29E475A95C449F517DD15F2.description: Reach and defend informed conclusions based on best evidence

A0758658E21F432C88CA2F91858C3131.description: Share experiences, participate in decision-making, and collaboratively identify methods of assessing the usefulness of ideas and sources, to build new knowledge, create new works, and solve problems

6817F2997F9C4785A4CABC99AD66A3BA.description: Collaborate with others to exchange ideas, develop new understandings, make decisions, and solve problems

0A2EAA63B2644C2191AA404B7934B7A6.description: Make personal connections to topics of interest (personal experience, expertise, interest in new ideas and for academic or personal development) in order to locate and use information from credible sources, to extend complexity in thinking about a current event, social issue or other real-world problem, and to generate solutions with insight and synthesis

D98B5CF5A0BB40629E7450B8D472D212.description: Use information to solve real-world problems and inspire further investigation

82710CC258F64EA490310B5272ABFA67.description: Answer questions using information (quoted or paraphrased correctly) in proper context, providing attribution using varied and multiple sources

D22352AAB61049AC8D9EC2A553498D79.description: Use information to answer questions and inspire further investigation

B3564D7594BC4942B8304C9EC41B64E7.description: Use tools to concurrently organize, analyze, and synthesize information

6114AEEC0320468DB4A160674265FA57.description: Analyze, organize, and synthesize information using a variety of tools

FEED0D13B6454FF99234575E15360422.description: To make an informed decision, evaluate information, examine multiple positions, points of view, forms of argument, and challenge one’s assumptions including confirmation bias

BD168A354CCB43F2A63F8CE319E9C6CA.description: Analyze and evaluate information to make informed decisions

5EF2349964C34E7D907400F7C518AAA0.description: Analyze subtleties, complexities, varying views, and reasoning, from multiple sources to draw conclusions

02BC7A6E06A445E988E209D93E6B2D2B.description: Analyze and evaluate information to draw conclusions

FF7A732C89BF49FBBFCA32D0F7FCA750.description: Use skills, resources, and tools to draw conclusions, make informed decisions, create new knowledge and apply knowledge to new situations

75376C7D7F5A4E76B307B99FAD581FFF.description: Reflect on the effectiveness of a research process including problem solving, and progress through developing a topic into a researchable question

B94F0579A70A4DCEB49FD3A33FA50E9A.description: Assess the effectiveness of questions, strategies, and processes used in research to find information

B2C057C05F294ABCA84ABFC6D371FCDF.description: Collaborate with others within digital and physical environments to build and improve content, develop new knowledge, and improve metaliteracies

08616124E07C4FB6AEC6F3E234C18117.description: Collaborate to broaden and deepen understanding

20CC5EDAE8DF477BBF848ABEDE35A704.description: Compare and use sources from a variety of digital formats and select the most appropriate for a specific purpose

D6B0B8AD591D4BD8B02D505A8F5707BE.description: Read, view, and listen to information in a variety of formats

C1AF44092C55427399BEE87B6AE6D64F.description: Evaluate information for accuracy, validity, importance, and bias, using increasingly complex qualifiers

89DCDE55916843BA8CD22242E943D44B.description: Evaluate information for accuracy, validity, importance, and bias

CA6AF2011C0E46B7807467613079522C.description: With support, select and use effective tools and source types with specific conventions, to access information, including specialized, subject-specific, and scholarly sources

EF1A783FD244495E938230B3B0BBABCA.description: Select and use tools within sources to access content

69DC73ACEDC5443CA6ECB1438E308AE5.description: Read laterally to evaluate the reliability of information, and evaluate sources for usefulness, relevance, author's expertise

BF83D9BBDF56486C9D5995A909E56F2D.description: Find, evaluate, and select appropriate sources to answer questions

6CBB1657EC674EB48940BB6A85274FC9.description: Use advanced search strategies and different types of search language (controlled vocabulary, natural or colloquial language, keywords) for different applications

319C5F2C30B84A0286EA1784245BDC59.description: Develop, select, clarify, and use strategies to search for information

61352086CF1742C88CF0677654A81028.description: Generate questions related to as well as embedded within a focused topic statement, evaluate those questions for perspective and point of view, identify research questions that practitioners or scholars are studying on the topic, and synthesize to a researchable question which addresses a problem or issue

057E88C9296B4A14A6332454D2B96B91.description: Develop, select, clarify, and use questions to search for information

8226761D41C74C28A3B01AADE708DBEC.description: Use divergent thinking (brainstorming, lateral thinking) and metacognitive reflection to surface prior knowledge, identify points of personal connection to apply to new knowledge, consider accuracy of prior knowledge, and to extend perceptions to include additional perspectives for next steps in research

788218DC22CC4436AB6C6719089C9CE1.description: Apply prior knowledge to new learning

81DE059987DC42C8A87939C8BE906EFB.description: Develop a researchable question which demonstrates curiosity about a topic

65BF728EABC1473995E6625061F4EC65.description: Follow an inquiry-based process to seek knowledge

11BF30371AEB4A6F9FE5F46271A974E1.description: Use skills, resources, and tools to inquire, think critically, and gain knowledge

D8E69EACE2734FB4A3309701A2501396.description: INFORMATION LITERACY Use strategies for locating, selecting, organizing, understanding, evaluating, using, and producing information, within physical and digital information environments
